column5: Thanks for the report and good for them for expanding their business.

Well, my first trip of the season is in the bag and it was a good one! My son and traveled to Hawk Junction, Ontario to visit Air-Dale Lodge (formerly Totomenai Lodge) on Whitefish and Manitowik lake's. We had an ambitious plan with only 4 days of fishing with different species of fish on tap. Brook trout, lake trout, splake and walleye.The brook trout and splake were in nearby back lakes, the lakers and walleye we fished on the main lake.It really was a great success. I was somewhat surprised at the quality of the fishing especially being a drive-to lodge in NE Ontario. If you're at all curious you can read the full story here, as always lots of photos and video!http://www.canadafishingguide.net/a-...ir-dale-lodge/Cheers, Mike
Thanks Mike nice report and as always excellent job on the details, well done.
Those are some real nice trout pictures! Your son will have more stories and experiences than half of walleye central by the time he can drive. Well done
Great report, the Kid did really well.

Thanks guys! Brendan is already a fanatic, he's definitely caught the bug!I'm leaving for Gangler's in Manitoba this morning and the kid is having fits cause he can't go. I can't bring him on every trip, but I still feel terrible right now. He does get on plenty of trips though.Any dad can relate - this is what it's all about!
Another great report Mike. Thanks for sharing.

Aw brings back memories , fishing a bit down from the sanctuary where the Shikumkwa River enters Whitefish Lake. (from your movie). I used to take my 9.9 merc up those rapids under the logging bridge when water was high......a thrill at best a prop hit at worst. Also looks like you found where another stream enters the lake ...did you snag my anchor I lost there back in 2007 . (next to the one car sized boulder just exposed in your movie!) Nice to hear Totonomei is still thriving and now under new management . Us locals camp owners used to call "two too many" ...smile
Mike, another great trip with your son! Your giving him memories forever!! Great reading and report as expected, great pics and story.
Wow, you guys did great up there!
